_explanation.hierarchical: sub_epics can contain: nested sub_epics or story_groups. sequential_order is always an integer (1, 2, 3, 4) - unique within parent, no decimals.
_explanation.connector: Story groups: 'and' or 'or' (null for first group). Stories within groups: 'and' or 'or' (null for first story). Epics and sub_epics don't have connectors.
_explanation.domain_placement: domain_concepts: 'local' if relevant to single sub_epic, 'global' if relevant to multiple sub_epics. Place at most specific level (local preferred), but elevate to parent if used by multiple children.
_explanation.increments_structure: The 'increments' section is a MINIMAL REFERENCE VIEW. Stories in increments contain ONLY: name, users (optional), sequential_order. All story details (story_type, connector, etc.) come from the main 'epics' section. Increments are just a copy of the outline view at the story level to map which stories belong to which increment.
